name: Anthro
description: An Anthropogenic Context Project summarizes anthropogenic impacts to riverscapes and channels. It uses roads, railroads, canals, land cover and land use as inputs from a [Riverscapes Context Project](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/) to look at infrastructure intersecting riverscape and channel networks, as well as land uses within and adjacent to the riverscape. The Anthropogenic Context Tool adds attributes to stream network reaches and to points along the riverscape (valley bottom) center line that help to contextualize potential anthropogenic impacts to the riverscape. These attributes are used in portions of the [BRAT](https://tools.riverscapes.net/brat) and [RCAT](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rcat) models./n Anthro is a [production-grade, hybrid channel network and riverscape network model](https://tools.riverscapes.net/).

name: Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (BRAT) - Channel Network
description: The [Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool](https://tools.riverscapes.net/brat) combines a model estimating the capacity of a riverscape to support dam building activity with analysis of potential anthropogenic conflicts to create a tool that can be used to inform where [LTPBR restoration](http://lowtechpbr.restoration.usu.edu/) using beaver can be targeted.

name: Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (BRAT) - Riverscape Network
summary: The hybrid channel network/riverscape network Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (sqlBRAT)
description: The [Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool](https://tools.riverscapes.net/brat) combines a model estimating the capacity of a riverscape to support dam building activity with analysis of potential anthropogenic conflicts to create a tool that can be used to inform where [LTPBR restoration](http://lowtechpbr.restoration.usu.edu/) using beaver can be targeted./n/n Hafen, K.C.; Wheaton, J.M.; Roper, B.B.; Bailey, P.; Macfarlane, W.W.; Neilson, B.T.; Tennant, C.J. Estimating Increased Transient Water Storage with Increases in Beaver Dam Activity. Water 2024, 16, 1515. [https://doi.org/10.3390/w16111515](https://doi.org/10.3390/w16111515)

name: CAD Export - CHaMP
description: In the [CHAMP](https://champmonitoring.org) site visits, topographic surveys were collected with total stations. This is the raw topographic exports including points and breaklines in a DXF format. This was used as input into [CHaMP Topo Processing Toolbar](http://champtools.northarrowresearch.com/) to produce TINs and DEMs.

name: CHaMP Metrics
description: This script summarized all site level visits across all CHaMP sites.

name: Channel Area
description: The [Channel Area tool](https://tools.riverscapes.net/channelarea) generates polygons representing the active channel network within a watershed. It is used as an input into [TauDEM](https://tools.riverscapes.net/taudem) and [VBET](https://tools.riverscapes.net/vbet). The default CONUS implementation is based on the NHD+HR inputs from [Riverscapes Context](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/), whereby it uses a mix of flow area and waterbody polygons where they exist, and for the rest of the drainage network, uses a buffer based on an estimate of bankfull width from a regional curve.

name: Electric Conductivity - CHaMP
description: Electric Conductivity was used to aid in producing network-scale gross primary production models.

name: FHM - CHaMP
description: For every [CHaMP](https://champmonitoring.org) site visit, FIS and HSC driven fish habitat models were automatically run for spawning and rearing lifestages of Chinook and Steelhead. A professional-grade version of the same models is [here](https://habitat.northarrowresearch.com/).

name: GCD
description: The [GCD software](https://gcd.riverscapes.net/) was developed primarily for topographic change detection in rivers, but will work for simple, raster-based change detection of any two surfaces. The volumetric change in storage is calculated from the difference in surface elevations from digital elevation models (DEMs) derived from repeat topographic surveys./n NOTE: GCD Projects are only viewable in the GCD Software and as Riverscape Projects they are simply discoverable in the [Data Exchange](https://data.riverscapes.net) and show the project extents.

name: GRTS - CHaMP
summary: Generalized Random Tessellation Stratified Sample Frames - CHaMP
description: Generalized Random Tessellation Stratified sample frames used for Study Designs in CHaMP Priority Watersheds.

name: GUT
description: The tool delineates instream geomorphic units (GUs) from topography using a 3-tiered hierarchical classification adapted from Wheaton et al., [2015](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.geomorph.2015.07.010)).

name: Hydraulics - CHaMP
description: These are hydraulic model results, using a depth averaged version of Delft 3D for every [CHaMP](https://champmonitoring.org) visit (Topo survey).

name: RIM
description: [RIM](https://rim.riverscapes.net/) is a protocol for the efficient mapping of structurally forced inundation patterns in beaver impacted riverscapes.The RIM protocol is accessible from [Riverscapes Studio](https://qris.riverscapes.net), and these scripts package the tool outputs into RIM riverscapes projects.

name: LST
description: SQLite Database of land surface temperature summaries for HUC 4s.

name: National Datasets
description: National Datasets are containers for nationally available data to be accessed by the [Riverscapes Context model](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/), to package up for individual catchments. These datasets are not necessarily curated for all inputs to Riverscapes Context. Instead they are produced when national data is not available via a reliable API (e.g. when available only from a FTP server). These datasets are manually downloaded, curated and remain static (unlike datasets made available from a National Government and periodically updated and made available via their API.

name: PBR Planning Model - Bespoke
description: A bespoke analysis for USFWS in the Klamath Basin to identify potential riverscape reaches with uplift potential from process based restoration.

name: PyBRAT
summary: Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (pyBRAT - v <= 3.1, superseded by sqlBRAT)
description: The original [BRAT](https://brat.riverscapes.net/) tool runs from the research-grade version of the tool.

name: QRF  - CHaMP
summary: Quantile Regression Forest of CHaMP Metrics

name: RCA  - CHaMP
description: Riparian Condition Assessment Tool runs for CHaMP Program.

name: Riparian Condition Assessment Tool (RCAT)
description: Riparian Condition Assessment Tool (RCAT)

name: RVD - CHaMP
description: Riparian Vegetation Departure (RVD)

name: Riverscapes Context
description: The [Riverscapes Context tool](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/) automatically aggregates a variety of nationally available spatial datasets into a riverscapes project for a given watershed (e.g. HUC10 or 8). These data can then be used for contextual purposes, mapping, or as input data in other production-grade network tools.

name: Sediment Fingerprinting
description: Sediment fingerprinting data that has been collected within the Mississippi River Basin into a coherent database, which contains 225,035 samples and a total of 3,715,811 geochemical measurements.

name: TauDEM
description: The TauDEM is a suite of tools for topographic analysis using DEMs.

name: VBET
description: The [Valley Bottom Extraction Tool](https://tools.riverscapes.net/vbet) uses a DEM and a channel area network to estimate the valley bottom extents (area that could plausibly flood in contemporary natural flow regime) thereby defining the riverscape network.

name: LTPBR Design
description: Low-Tech Process Based Restoration Design exported from the QGIS Riverscapes Studio plug-in (QRiS). This project contains design structures (points, lines, complexes) and zones of influence.

name: VBET Synthesis
summary: Combined IGO points for collections of VBET runs.
description: Extracts IGOs from multiple VBET projects and combines them into a single GeoPackage for further analysis.

name: Riverscapes Context (British Columbia)
summary: Riverscapes Context for British Columbia Watersheds
description: The [Riverscapes Context tool](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/) automatically aggregates a variety of nationally available spatial datasets into a riverscapes project for a given watershed (e.g. HUC10 or 8). These data can then be used for contextual purposes, mapping, or as input data in other production-grade network tools.

name: Landscape Synthesis
description: The Landscape Synthesis project attributes geometries of watersheds with metrics from riverscapes projects summarized at the watershed scale.

name: LTPBR Projects
summary: Low Tech Process Based Restoration Projects
description: Details of Low Tech Process Based Restoration Projects captured in the LTPBR Explorer online system. The LTPBR Explorer is a web-based tool that provides access to a database of Low Tech Process Based Restoration (LTPBR) projects. The LTPBR Explorer is a product of the Riverscapes Consortium, a group of scientists and practitioners working to advance the science and practice of river restoration. The LTPBR Explorer is designed to help users learn about LTPBR projects, explore the methods used in these projects, and access data and information that can be used to inform future restoration efforts. The LTPBR Explorer is a work in progress, and new projects are being added regularly. If you have a project that you would like to add to the LTPBR Explorer, please login to the system and click the Add a Project button.

name: PIBO Riverscapes
summary: PIBO points attributed with riverscapes model data
description: PIBO monitoring sites with attributes from the riverscapes network models added to the points.

name: Riverscapes Studio
summary: Riverscapes Studio project exported from QRiS
description: Riverscapes Studio project exported from the QGIS Riverscapes Studio plug-in (QRiS). This project contains LTPBR planning, design, and monitoring event layers, as well as contextual layers and surfaces.

name: Hydrologic Context
summary: Hydrologic Context project for estimating flow and stream power values
description: Estimates low flow, Q2 flood, low stream power, and Q2 stream power for input stream network and DGO features.

name: BLMContext
description: The BLM Context Project is a collection of national datasets that provide contextual information useful for planning stream restoration projects in Bureau of Land Management (BLM) priority watersheds.

name: Beaver Activity
summary: Beaver dam and beaver sign project
description: A project to store point feature classes representing locations of beaver dams and beaver sign based on desktop census and field data.

name: Riverscapes IGOs
summary: Riverscapes integrated geographic objects scraped from RME projects into a synthesis project at other scales.
description: Riverscapes integrated geographic objects scraped from [RME](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rme/) projects into a synthesis project at other scales.

name: New Zealand National Datasets
description: National Datasets are containers for nationally available data to be accessed by the [Riverscapes Context model](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/), to package up for individual catchments. These datasets are not necessarily curated for all inputs to Riverscapes Context. Instead they are produced when national data is not available via a reliable API (e.g. when available only from a FTP server). These datasets are manually downloaded, curated and remain static (unlike datasets made available from a National Government and periodically updated and made available via their API.

name: Riverscapes Context (New Zealand)
description: Riverscapes Context project type for New Zealand. Contains hydrography and topography data for individual New Zealand watersheds.

name: Italian National Datasets
description: National Datasets are containers for nationally available data to be accessed by the [Riverscapes Context model](https://tools.riverscapes.net/rscontext/), to package up for individual catchments. These datasets are not necessarily curated for all inputs to Riverscapes Context. Instead they are produced when national data is not available via a reliable API (e.g. when available only from a FTP server). These datasets are manually downloaded, curated and remain static (unlike datasets made available from a National Government and periodically updated and made available via their API.

name: Beaver Dam Water Storage (BDWS)
summary: Distributing beaver dams and calculating the water storage associated with them.
description: Beaver Dam Water Storage (BDWS) is a collection of Python classes for estimating surface water and groundwater stored by beaver dams. BDWS uses beaver dam capacity estimates from the Beaver Restoration Assessment Tool (BRAT) to place beaver dams along stream reaches, flow direction algebra to determine the area inundated by a dam, and MODFLOW-2005 to model potential changes to groundwater tables from beaver dam construction. BDWS is comprised of three classes. BDLoG (Beaver Dam Location Generator), which generates beaver dam locations along a stream network using BRAT outputs. BDSWEA (Beaver Dam Surface Water Estimation Algorithm), which estimates the amount of water a beaver dam of a given height at a given location could potentially store. BDflopy (Beaver Dam flopy), which uses the existing FloPy python module to automatically parameterize and run MODFLOW-2005 to estimate changes to groundwater storage resulting from beaver dam construction.
